original: 2. CO-BRANDED CAREER CENTER AND CO-BRANDED EQUIPMENT LISTINGS 2.1. No later than seven days after the Effective Date, VerticalNet shall, at VerticalNet's sole cost and expense, design, develop and implement the Co-Branded Sites  with the overall "look and feel" agreed upon by VerticalNet and PaperExchange, as shown in Exhibit A. After the Co-Branded Sites  are implemented, VerticalNet shall notify PaperExchange in writing at least five days prior to making any material change to a Co-Branded Site, including, without limitation, a change in the location, sizing or placement of the PaperExchange Links. If PaperExchange does not notify VerticalNet of its rejection of such change within five days, PaperExchange shall be deemed to have approved such change. VerticalNet shall design, host and maintain the Co-Branded Sites at its sole cost and expense. Within 30 days after the Effective Date, VerticalNet and PaperExchange shall agree upon the Co-Branded URLs . The parties shall register the Co-Branded URLs  reasonably promptly after the parties have agreed upon them.

2.1. original: 4.3. Non-Competition.
ollama_generated:
4.3. Limited Competition Obligations.

During the term of this agreement and for a period of twelve (12) months thereafter, the Contractor shall not engage in any business that is substantially similar to the services provided under this Agreement within a geographical radius of fifty (50) miles from the primary location where such services were performed. This restriction shall not apply to activities that are de minimis or passively managed by the Contractor.

original: 4.3.2. During the Term, PaperExchange shall not place any advertisements on the PaperExchange Site  from any Pulp and Paper Online Competitor.
modified: 4.3.2. For the duration of the Term, it is at the discretion of PaperExchange to feature advertisements originating from entities that compete with Pulp and Paper Online, on the PaperExchange Site, provided such placement does not exceed more than 20% of the total number of ads displayed within the same timeframe. Any exceeding amount will require prior written consent from the competing entity.

original: 5.1.2. VerticalNet, in its reasonable business discretion, shall offer PaperExchange exhibit booth space at pulp and paper industry trade shows that VerticalNet is unable to use on the same terms that VerticalNet accepted for such space.
modified: 5.1.2. Upon PaperExchange's request, and subject to its reasonable business discretion, VerticalNet may make available exhibit booth space at pulp and paper industry trade shows where VerticalNet is not using the space, on terms that are less favorable compared to those originally accepted by VerticalNet for such space. In such instances, PaperExchange shall have the option, but not the obligation, to utilize this offered space.

original: 5.3.2. VerticalNet shall, in its reasonable business discretion, promote Pulp and Paper Online  through print medium.
ollama_generated: 5.3.2. While VerticalNet maintains the right to exercise its independent marketing strategies, it is understood that they will give due consideration to promoting Pulp and Paper Online in print medium, if deemed advantageous for both parties within their business judgment.

original: 5.3.3. VerticalNet and PaperExchange shall co-promote the PaperExchange Home Page  and Pulp and Paper Online  in mutually agreeable advertising and collateral marketing material. All co-promotion advertising materials produced by or on behalf of either party (the "Originating Party") shall be subject to the written approval of the other party (the "Receiving Party"), which approval shall not to be unreasonably withheld, delayed or conditioned. The Receiving Party shall notify the Originating Party of its approval or disapproval of such advertising materials as soon as practicable, but in any event within five business days after Receiving Party's receipt thereof. Any failure of the Receiving Party to respond within such five business day period shall be deemed disapproval of the advertising materials in question.
modified: 5.3.3. While PaperExchange and VerticalNet are encouraged to co-promote the PaperExchange Home Page and Pulp and Paper Online, there is no binding obligation to do so. Any co-promotion advertising materials developed by either party (the "Originating Party") may be utilized without prior written approval from the other party (the "Receiving Party"). However, the Receiving Party has the right to express concerns or objections regarding these materials within five business days of receipt, at which point any silence on their part will be construed as acceptance. The Originating Party should aim to take into account the Receiving Party's potential reservations, but is under no obligation to modify the materials based on such feedback.

original: 5.8.1. During the Term and for a period of four years after the termination of this Agreement, VerticalNet shall not, directly or indirectly, by itself, through its Affiliates or through any type of joint venture or similar affiliation with a third party, without prior written approval from PaperExchange, buy, sell or trade (a) paper pulp products through exchanges, auctions, or reverse auctions or any other e-commerce medium, (b) paper (other than finished paper-based products, including, but not limited to, books, stamps and labels) and copy paper (i) through exchanges, auctions or reverse auctions or (ii) in quantities greater than one ton through any e-commerce medium, (c) raw materials used to make paper packaging, including, but not limited to, linerboard, medium, other containerboard grades and corrugated sheet through exchanges, auctions, reverse auctions or any other e-commerce medium, or (d) paper rolls and reels weighing more than 50 pounds used by printers through exchanges, auctions, reverse auctions or any other e-commerce medium; provided, however, that this Section 5.8.1   [Non-Competition]  shall not apply to advertisements, Storefronts or similar features on VerticalNet's Sites.
5.9. Exchange.
modified:
5.9. Counter-Exchange.

In the event that Party A delivers the agreed goods or services (the "Deliverable"), Party B shall have a good faith opportunity to inspect and evaluate the Deliverable, at its sole discretion, within thirty (30) days of receipt. If Party B elects not to accept the Deliverable, it shall notify Party A in writing without undue delay, and return the Deliverable in its original condition within five (5) business days. Party A shall have no obligation to offer any compensation or alternative Deliverables in such circumstances. However, if Party B fails to provide timely written notice or returns the Deliverable in a damaged condition, it shall be responsible for paying Party A an amount equal to the reasonable cost of repair or replacement of the Deliverable, as determined by Party A in its sole discretion.

original: 9.5. Two Year Limitation. Except for claims under Sections 12.4   [Indemnification by PaperExchange]  and 12.5  [Indemnification by VerticalNet] hereof, neither party may bring a claim or action regardless of form, arising out of or related to this Agreement, including any claim of fraud or misrepresentation, more than two years after the cause of action accrues or becomes known, whichever is later.

original: 10. CONFIDENTIALITY 10.1. Confidentiality Obligations. Except as permitted elsewhere under this Agreement, each party agrees to take Reasonable Steps (as defined below) (a) to receive and maintain the Confidential Information  of the other party in confidence, (b) not to disclose such Confidential Information  to any third parties and (c) to promptly notify the disclosing party upon learning of any law, rule, regulation or court order that purports to compel disclosure of any Confidential Information  of the disclosing party and to reasonably cooperate with the disclosing party in the exercise of the disclosing party's right to protect the confidentiality of such Confidential Information . Neither party hereto shall use all or any part of the Confidential Information  of the other party for any purpose other than to perform its obligations under this Agreement. The parties will take Reasonable Steps (as defined below) to ensure that their employees, representatives and agents comply with this provision. As used herein, "Reasonable Steps" means at least the same degree of care that the receiving party uses to protect its own Confidential Information , and, in no event, no less than reasonable care.
ollama_generated:
10. LIMITED CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS:

10.1. Limitation on Disclosure: Each party agrees to employ Minimum Precautions (as defined below) to preserve the confidential nature of the Confidential Information of the other party, while acknowledging that this obligation is not absolute and may be subject to certain statutory or regulatory requirements. The parties understand that disclosures required by law, rule, regulation or court order may supersede these obligations. In such cases, the receiving party shall give immediate notice to the disclosing party about the disclosure, and shall cooperate with the disclosing party in seeking protective measures or a waiver where possible.

10.2. Permitted Use: Each party reserves the right to use the Confidential Information of the other party as necessary for the performance of their respective obligations under this Agreement, but shall not share it with any third parties without prior written consent. The parties will ensure that their employees, representatives and agents are aware of and adhere to these restrictions.

10.3. Definition of Minimum Precautions: For purposes of this section, "Minimum Precautions" means the minimum degree of care a prudent business would take in protecting its own Confidential Information under similar circumstances. In no event shall the Minimum Precautions require a level of protection greater than that provided to the receiving party's own Confidential Information.

Techne Thermal Cycler 0.5ML 117V (Item #: 500863) [GRAPHIC OMITTED] - Techne Gene E Thermal Cycler, suitable for DNA sequencing, gene manipulation, and other techniques using 0.5 mL tubes. This equipment is optimized for cooling efficiency, with refrigerated coolant capable of achieving cooling rates up to 2.7(degrees)C per second. Powered by 117V and priced at $1,000. Dynasty Tool Kit No. 9422 (Item #: 500607) [GRAPHIC OMITTED] - Dynasty Tool Kit No. 9422 containing 120 tools, intended for the assistance of our customer service engineers as stipulated in Exhibit A(2). Leader LFC-944B Level Meter (Item #: 500608) [GRAPHIC OMITTED] - Portable battery-operated Leader LFC-944B Level Meter, designed for on-site assessment of CATV and MATV systems. original: Brief Job Description:
ollama_generated:
Clause:
   Brief Job Description:

In the event that the Service Provider fails to timely deliver the contracted services as specified in this Agreement, the Client shall have the discretion, but not the obligation, to withhold payment for such delayed deliveries. However, any payment withheld shall be remitted to the Service Provider within a reasonable timeframe upon the Services being delivered in full and satisfactorily. This provision does not absolve the Service Provider from their duty to meet agreed deadlines or relieve the Client of their obligation to pay for services properly rendered.

Brief Job Description:

Upon delayed delivery of contracted services by the Service Provider, the Client reserves the option to postpone payment, although this is not a mandatory requirement. Delayed payments shall be returned to the Service Provider once the services are completed and deemed satisfactory. Nevertheless, the Service Provider remains accountable for meeting deadlines, and the Client continues to have a duty to pay for services duly provided.

Clause:
- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Duration of Response*      By default, the timeframe for response is set at 7 days. However, we are flexible and can accommodate responses within the following durations: 1, 3, 5, 7, 14, or 30 days.

Note that while the default duration is 7 days, we encourage prompt response times and aim to respond as quickly as possible, depending on the complexity of the matter at hand.

modified:
- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- PaperExchange.com Internal Tracking - Sales Person Obligation

Sales Person shall not be required to actively monitor or track sales, but is encouraged to provide updates and participate in the internal tracking system for PaperExchange.com, as doing so may assist in performance evaluation and improvement initiatives. The use of this system is optional and any data provided by the Sales Person shall be considered voluntary and at their own discretion. Any discrepancies or inaccuracies in the reported sales data shall not be held against the Sales Person, and PaperExchange.com assumes no responsibility for ensuring accurate reporting.
